onboarding_question_date.message_text: Sorry, this date is invalid. Please write your child's date of birth in this way: YYYY/MM/DD. For example, if your child was born on May 19, 2015, write 2015/05/19.
The date you entered is in the future. Please write your child's date of birth in this way: YYYY/MM/DD. For example, if your child was born on May 19, 2015, write  2015/05/19.

According to the date you gave, Your Child would be @(round_down(datetime_diff(results.date,now(),"M")/12)) years old. ParentText is only for children aged 2-9. If your child is aged 2-9, please write the date for your child's birth in this way: YYYY/MM/DD. For example, if your child was born on May 19, 2015, write  2015/05/19.
Your Child is @(round_down(datetime_diff(results.date,now(),"M")/12)) years old. Is that correct?
Let's try again. Please write your child's date of birth in this way: YYYY/MM/DD. For example, if your child was born on May 19, 2015, write  2015/05/19.
Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.

According to the date you gave, Your Child would be @(round_down(datetime_diff(results.date,now(),"M")/12)) years old. ParentText is only for children aged 2-9. If your child is aged 2-9, please write the date for your child's birth in this way: YYYY/MM/DD. For example, if your child was born on May 19, 2015, write 2015/05/19.

onboarding_question_date_data.question: When was Your Child born? Enter their date of birth in the following format: YYYY/MM/DD. For example, if your child was born on May 19, 2015, enter 2015/5/19.

onboarding_question_with_opt_data_local.question: ParentText is easiest to use when you receive content as videos, images and text. However, your data bundle and bandwidth may not support videos. To save on data, you can opt to receive the same content as text and illustrations. How would you like to receive ParentText?

🎉CONGRATULATIONS!🎉 You have earned a badge and completed the goal @results.name. Well done!

Click to see your new badge
